requirements.description:
Seeking a suitable candidate for the role of Business Analyst:

Project leadership:

  • Lead analysis of a fit for purpose software solution, for integration into existing network and security infrastructure, and build a plan for procurement.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders within the Agency and department, and external software vendors, to gain a detailed understanding of user, technical and security requirements.
  • Represent the interests of the Agency as a member of a multi-disciplinary team, act as champion for the solution and lead the project to successfully onboard the software.
  • Facilitate workshops, including those to identify business needs, monitor and collate data and identify competing demands.
  • Identify, elicit and verify business needs, and interpret technical requirements, to inform effective decision-making and meet the key objectives of the project.

Software implementation:

  • Assess the chosen software solution in consideration of departmental ICT architecture, security, product strategy and program commitments.
  • Ensure all stakeholders, including the multi-disciplinary delivery team, have understood the Agency's requirements and work effectively towards achieving agreed objectives.
  • Understand and anticipate user needs and actively liaise with subject matter experts to ensure user needs are represented in the implemented solution and prioritised backlog.
  • Capture, analyse and deconflict user, technical and security requirements and clearly define deliverables in line with the project schedule.
  • Plan the operational implementation of the solution and change management to ensure the value of the software is maximised.

Successful delivery:

  • Act as the primary contact between the multi-disciplinary delivery team, external software vendors and users, describing the vision and objectives for the project.
  • Inform project decisions, collaborating closely with the Product Owner to accept or reject work based on the delivery of expected outcomes.
  • Manage feedback to guide technical integration and lead any remediation activities required to keep the project on track.
  • Achieve agreement and the formal sign-off of requirements by stakeholders within the Agency and department, and external vendors, and governance groups as required.
  • Collaborate closely with the Enterprise Architecture, Cyber Security and vendor teams, leading necessary adaptations to deliver successful outcomes.
  • Construct documentation to support the requirements definition.

requirements.description:
The request seeks to engage experienced sellers who have capability to provide inventory support services to support the development of Malaysia’s greenhouse gas information management system (GHG-IMS).


The Malaysian GHG-IMS project will be delivered between the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) and Malaysia’s Kementerian Alam Sekitar dan Air – Environment and Water Ministry (KASA), under the Australia-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.


The project builds on Australia’s more than 20 years’ experience and expertise in national greenhouse gas inventories, and more recently, Australia’s successful collaboration with Thailand in jointly designing and building the Thai inventory IT system known as TGEIS.


The project will build a bespoke inventory management system that enhances Malaysia’s capacity in fulfilling its national reporting obligations under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and Paris Agreement, as well as support Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) implementation.


The Seller will participate in the custom build-out of the GHG-IMS Generic Framework Template to suit Malaysia’s need, support peer-to-peer learning and collaboration activities between Australian and Malaysian officials, and if required, assist Malaysia in procuring the necessary software and cloud-based server licencing.

The Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water is seeking a 5+ years experienced Test Manager to join the agile project in a fast-paced dynamic environment.  Previous experience with testing in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) – (SAP to TechnologyOne or SAP to Aurion) is essential. The project is to establish a new ERP suite of systems for the Department driven by recent Machinery of Government change. The Test Manager will be responsible for the delivery and acceptance of all testing aspects of the ERP Program.

requirements.description:
The request seeks to engage an experienced service provider who has the capability to provide:

Introduction

The Department of Defence with an enterprise-wide video based/digital online learning platform.

The video based/digital online learning platform needs to help all staff gain new skills and advance their professional careers. The aim is to provide just-in-time learning that features instructional content relevant to employee’s professional and personal interests and goals. Requirement

The enterprise wide video based/digital online learning platform for whole of Defence will:

  1. Provide unlimited access for users covering a wide range of topics such as leadership, business, creative skills and technology.
  2. Offer personalised recommendations and explore the most in-demand skills/reward based on each personal experience.
  3. Provide learning content by industry expert instructors, learn from industry leaders and provide a hands on approach to learning.
  4. Provide access to courses anywhere anytime as a convenient approach to learning, accessible from any desktop or mobile device.
  5. Offer self-paced learning with bite sized video content.
  6. Provide additional resources for each topic to reinforce new knowledge with quizzes and exercise files with the reward of certifications on completion of course.
  7. As required the seller (and online learning platform) will provide customised playlists on specific subject matters as requested by Defence.
  8. Provide function/service where individual Defence learners can download their learning history from the online platform and mobile application.

The Defence Protected Network (Workstation OS: Windows 10, Version 1703, OS Build 15063.1563) utilises three internet web browsers listed below with version numbers. Microsoft Edge: Version 40.15063.674.0 Internet Explorer, Version: 11.1563.15063.0 Google Chrome, Version: 66.0.3359.181 Other platforms such as the learner’s personal devices must also be supported within the service requirement.

The provision of an online video/digital learning platform via the Defence Protected Network, Australia wide WEF 29 March 2023. Work in consultation with Defence to facilitate learning workshops such as Lunch n Learn and Information sessions aimed at non-users and users at various Defence sites across the country. Agreed dates will be discussed between Defence and seller as required. Work with Defence Learning Branch to support to the Learn eXcel Perform (LXP) Project pilot, expected to run from December 2022 to May 2023. Agreed dates and locations will be discussed between Defence and seller as required.

The enterprise wide video based/digital learning platform will need to meet the requirements of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) standard, WCAG 2.0 AA, in support of accessibility requirements of all learners within Defence.

Security Requirements: ● The Seller is to ensure the handling of personal information is in accordance with the provisions of the Privacy Act 1988 (Commonwealth) ● The seller will be escorted and support by Defence APS staff while on Defence premises.

  • Construct documentation to support the requirements definition.

requirements.description:
The request seeks to engage experienced sellers who have capability to provide inventory support services to support the development of Malaysia’s greenhouse gas information management system (GHG-IMS).


The Malaysian GHG-IMS project will be delivered between the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) and Malaysia’s Kementerian Alam Sekitar dan Air – Environment and Water Ministry (KASA), under the Australia-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.


The project builds on Australia’s more than 20 years’ experience and expertise in national greenhouse gas inventories, and more recently, Australia’s successful collaboration with Thailand in jointly designing and building the Thai inventory IT system known as TGEIS.


The project will build a bespoke inventory management system that enhances Malaysia’s capacity in fulfilling its national reporting obligations under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and Paris Agreement, as well as support Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) implementation.


The Seller will participate in the custom build-out of the GHG-IMS Generic Framework Template to suit Malaysia’s need, support peer-to-peer learning and collaboration activities between Australian and Malaysian officials, and if required, assist Malaysia in procuring the necessary software and cloud-based server licencing.

requirements.description:
Attorney-General's Department requires an experienced Organisational Change Manager

The Organisational Change Manager will work closely with the Program Manager to manage the business and APS change activities to ensure effective delivery of the business and APS capability and enable optimal realisation of desired, measurable benefits.


The Organisational Change Manager will apply comprehensive knowledge of principles, practices and theories as they relate to effective project and change management, with particular regard to PRINCE2, Agile and PROSCI methodologies.


The Organisational Change Manager will develop Change Management Plans and relevant change artefacts to ensure the best outcomes for the relevant stakeholders; covering holistic approach and using five change management levers to drive successful change i.e. communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan and resistance management plan.


The Organisational Change manager will lead, manage and develop the strategy, implementation and evaluation of the project’s benefit management plan and roadmap to ensure that the benefits are agreed with the Benefit Owner, and their realisation is monitored progress against the milestones

As part of this role the successful candidate will be required to deliver the following:

  • Develop and deliver a Change management strategy and plan for the project.
  • Develop and deliver a communication management strategy and plan for the project.
  • Work as a member of project team to execute the agreed plan across all project stakeholders, where the plan will include (but is not limited to):
    • communications for the projects,
    • stakeholder management,
    • user engagement and participation.
    • implementation of the future system,
    • user training,
    • support,
    • business process improvement.
  • Develop and deliver a change management plan structure and approach (including templates) that will assist stakeholders to subsequently develop their own internal change management plans for the project outputs. This plan will require clear role and responsibilities definition between the stakeholders and the project(s).
  • Provide weekly reports to the nominated manager / executive.
  • Report to and attend project meetings as required including project boards or user advisory groups.
